subject: Re: Runnable JAR, creating separate main()
msgSnippet: Ah yes, this looks done more properly. Thanks Joakim //////////////////////////////////////////////// package embrowsers; import org.junit.runner.JUnitCore;
messageBody:
Ah yes, this looks done more properly.
Thanks Joakim

////////////////////////////////////////////////
package embrowsers;

import org.junit.runner.JUnitCore;

public class RunnableEM {

public static void main(String args[]) {

JUnitCore core= new JUnitCore();
core.run(ChromeEM.class, FirefoxEM.class,
InternetexplorerEM.class);
}
}
///////////////////////////////////////////////

So for those trying to export as runnable jar, this is one way.
The main thing is to create a separate class with a main() in it and export as runnable jar with required libraries packaged into the JAR.
